questions.prompt: Which one of the following is NOT a UI Action type?
questions.explanation: UI Action Types: Form button, Form context menu, Form link, List banner button, List bottom button, List context menu, List choice, List link

questions.prompt: In an Email Notification, which one of the following is NOT true for the Weight field?
choices: Only Notifications with the highest weight for the same record and recipients are sent
A Weight value of zero means that no email should be sent
The Weight value defaults to zero
A Weight value of zero means the Notification is always sent when the Notification's "When to sent criteria is met"
correct_answers: A Weight value of zero means that no email should be sent
questions.explanation: The default weight value causes the system to always send the notification (assuming the conditions are met)

questions.prompt: When creating new application files in a scoped application, cross-scope access is turned on by default in which of the following? (Select two)
questions.explanation: By default, cross-scope access is turned on in Table and Workflow

questions.prompt: Which Application Access configuration field(s) are NOT available if the "Can read" configuration field is NOT selected?
choices: All access to this table via web services
"Can read" does not affect the availability of other Application Access fields
questions.explanation: The three other fields are read-only until "Can read" is checked

questions.prompt: Which of the following is NOT a trigger type in Flow Designer?
questions.explanation: Official CAD book mentions the following trigger types: Application triggers, Record triggers, Schedule triggers

questions.prompt: To see what scripts, reports, and other application artifacts will be in a published application:
choices: Enter the name of the Application in the Global search field
Open the list of Update Sets for the instance
Examine the Application Files Related List in the application to be published
Open the artifact records individually to verify the value in the Application field
correct_answers: Examine the Application Files Related List in the application to be published
questions.explanation: In order to see ALL application artifacts, you need to search for the Application Files Related List.

questions.prompt: Which one of the following is NOT a debugging strategy for client-side scripts?
questions.explanation: gs.log - Glide System ServiceNow API. It is only available for server-side scripts, not client-side.

questions.prompt: Which of the following statements is true for the Form Designer?
choices: To add a field to the form layout, drag the field from the Fields tab to the desired destination on the form.
To create a new field on a form’s table, drag the appropriate data type from the Field Types tab to the form and then configure the new field.
To remove a field from the form layout, hover over the field to enable the Action buttons, and select the Delete (X) button.
To add a section to the form layout, drag it from the Field Types tab to the desired destination on the form.
correct_answers: To add a field to the form layout, drag the field from the Fields tab to the desired destination on the form.
To remove a field from the form layout, hover over the field to enable the Action buttons, and select the Delete (X) button.
questions.explanation: You can add a new section by clicking the '+' button. There is no Field Type as a 'section'.

questions.prompt: Which of the following are configured in an Email Notification?
choices: What content will be in the notification.
correct_answers: What content will be in the notification.
questions.explanation: There is no configuration option as 'How to send the notification'.

questions.prompt: Which objects can you use in a Scheduled Script Execution (Scheduled Job) script?
questions.explanation: You can use only Server-Side APIs, so GlideUser is incorrect. You cannot use 'current' or 'previous' as well.

questions.prompt: When a ServiceNow instance requests information from a web service, ServiceNow is the web service:
questions.explanation: "Web services make it possible for applications to connect to other software applications over a network, allowing an exchange of information between the provider (server) and the consumer (client)."

questions.prompt: Which one of the following is the fastest way to create and configure a Record Producer?
choices: Create a Catalog Category, open the category, and select the Add New Record Producer button
Use the Record Producer module then add and configure all variables manually
Open the table in the Table records and select the Add to Service Catalog Related Link
Open the table's form, right-click on the form header, and select the Create Record Producer menu item
correct_answers: Open the table in the Table records and select the Add to Service Catalog Related Link
questions.explanation: "The Add to Service Catalog Related Link" on a Table record creates a Record Producer.

questions.prompt: Which of the following methods are useful in Access Control scripts?
questions.explanation: Access Control scripts accept only server-side APIs. Hence, any client-side API like GlideUser or GlideForm is not applicable. There is no such thing as 'current.isNew()'.

questions.prompt: Which one of the following client-side scripts applies to Record Producers?
choices: Catalog Client Script and Catalog UI Policies
UI Scripts and Record Producer Scripts
correct_answers: Catalog Client Script and Catalog UI Policies

questions.prompt: When configuring an Access Control that has no condition or script, which one of the following statements is NOT true?
choices: <table.*> will grant access to every field in a record
<table.None> will grant access to every record on the table
<table.field> will grant access to a specific field in a record
<table.id> will grant access to a specific record on the table
correct_answers: <table.id> will grant access to a specific record on the table

questions.prompt: How must Application Access be configured to prevent all other private application scopes from creating configuration records on an application's data tables?
choices: You must create Access Controls to prevent all other application scopes from creating configuration records on an application's data tables rather than using Application Access.
Set the "Accessible from" field value to "All application scopes" and deselect the "Can create" option
Set the "Accessible from" field value to "This application scope" only and deselect the "Allow access to this table via web services" option
Set the "Accessible from" field value to "This application scope only"
correct_answers: Set the "Accessible from" field value to "This application scope only"
questions.explanation: The "Accessible from" field should be set as "This application scope only" in order to restrict creating configuration records.

questions.prompt: What are some of the benefits of extending an existing table such as the Task table when creating a new application?
choices: You can repurpose existing fields by simply changing the label.
Use existing fields with no modifications.
Existing logic from the parent table will be automatically applied to the new table.
All of the parent table records are copied to the new table.
correct_answers: You can repurpose existing fields by simply changing the label.
Use existing fields with no modifications.
Existing logic from the parent table will be automatically applied to the new table.
questions.explanation: "All of the parent table records are copied to the new table" is not true. Records are NOT copied.

questions.prompt: Which one of the following is NOT a method used for logging messages in a server-side script for a privately-scoped application?
questions.explanation: Instead of gs.log(), you can always use gs.info() for both global and privately-scoped applications.

questions.prompt: If the "Create module" field is selected when creating a table, what is the new module's default behavior?
choices: Open an empty form so new records can be created
Open a link to a wiki article with instructions on how to customize the behavior of the new module
Display an empty homepage for the application
Display a list view with potential table records
correct_answers: Display a list view with potential table records

questions.prompt: Which one of the following is NOT required to link a ServiceNow application to a Git repository?
questions.explanation: In order to connect your application to Source Control, you do not need the Application Name.

questions.prompt: Which Report Type(s) can be created by right-clicking on a column header in a table's list?
choices: Bar Chart, Pie Chart, Histogram, and Line
Bar Chart, Pie Chart, and Histogram
questions.explanation: Bar Chart and Pie Chart are the only chart options given.

questions.prompt: What is a Module?
choices: The functionality within an application menu such as links to other pages or records in the platform
A group of menus, or pages, providing related information and functionality to end-users
A way of helping users quickly access information and services by filtering the items in the Application Navigator
A web-based way providing software to end-users
correct_answers: The functionality within an application menu such as links to other pages or records in the platform
questions.explanation: Modules are the children, or the second-tier navigation options, to the applications in the application navigator. Modules often link to other pages or records in the platform.

questions.prompt: Which source control operation is available from BOTH Studio and the Git Repository?
questions.explanation: Create a branch in the repository to save a different version of the application.

questions.prompt: Which of the following methods prints a message on a blue background to the top of the current form by default?
questions.explanation: g_form.addInfoMessage() prints a message on a blue background to the top of the current form by default.

questions.prompt: A scoped application containing Flow Designer content dedicated to a particular application is called a(n):
questions.explanation: A scoped application containing Flow Designer content dedicated to a particular application is called a Spoke.

questions.prompt: What syntax is used in a Record Producer script to access values from Record Producer form fields?
questions.explanation: In a Record Producer script, you can access values from Record Producer form fields using the syntax producer.variablename.

questions.prompt: How many applications menus can an application have?
choices: 3, one for an application’s user modules, one for an application’s administrator modules, and one for the ServiceNow administrator’s modules
As many as the application design requires
2, one for an application’s user modules and one for an application’s administrator modules
1, which is used for all application modules
correct_answers: As many as the application design requires
questions.explanation: An application can have as many application menus as the application design requires.

questions.prompt: The source control operation used to store local changes on an instance for later application is called a(n) <blank>.
questions.explanation: The source control operation used to store local changes on an instance for later application is called a Stash.

questions.prompt: Which one of the following is part of the client-side scripting API?
questions.explanation: The GlideUser object (g_user) is part of the client-side scripting API.

questions.prompt: ServiceNow developers rely on industry-standard JavaScript to...
choices: Enable the right-click to edit the context menus on applications in the navigator
Customize the organization’s company logo and banner text
Configure the outgoing email display name
questions.explanation: ServiceNow developers rely on industry-standard JavaScript to extend and add functionality.

questions.prompt: Which of the following CANNOT be debugged using the Field Watcher?
questions.explanation: Script Includes cannot be debugged using the Field Watcher.

questions.prompt: Which objects can be used in Inbound Action scripts?
questions.explanation: In Inbound Action scripts, you can use the objects current and email, as well as current and event.

questions.prompt: It is best practice to define the business requirements and the process(es) an application will manage as part of the application development plan. What are some of the considerations to document as part of the business process?
choices: Business problem, data input/output, users/stakeholders, and process steps
Business problem, data input/output, project schedule, and process steps
Business problem, data input/output, users/stakeholders, and database capacity
Business problem, users/stakeholders, available licenses, and database capacity
correct_answers: Business problem, data input/output, users/stakeholders, and process steps
questions.explanation: When documenting the business process, it is important to include considerations such as the business problem, data input/output, users/stakeholders, and process steps.

questions.prompt: Which of the following statements does NOT apply when extending an existing table?
choices: The parent table’s Access Controls are evaluated when determining access to the new table’s records and fields
The new table inherits the functionality built into the parent table
The new table inherits all of the fields from the parent table
You must script and configure all required behaviors
correct_answers: You must script and configure all required behaviors
questions.explanation: When extending an existing table, the new table inherits the functionality and fields from the parent table. You do not necessarily have to script and configure all required behaviors.

questions.prompt: Which one of the following is the baseline behavior of a table in a privately-scoped application?
choices: The table and its data are not accessible using web services
Any Business Rule can read, write, delete, and update from the table
Only artifacts in the table’s application can read from the table
All application scopes can read from the table
correct_answers: All application scopes can read from the table
questions.explanation: In a privately-scoped application, all application scopes can read from the table by default.

questions.prompt: Which one of the following is NOT a purpose of application scoping?
choices: Provide a relationship between application artifacts
Provide a way of tracking the user who developed an application
Provide a namespace (prefix and scope name) to prevent cross-application name collisions
Provide controls for how scripts from another scope can alter tables in a scoped application
correct_answers: Provide a way of tracking the user who developed an application
questions.explanation: Application scoping provides a relationship between application artifacts, provides a namespace to prevent cross-application name collisions, and provides controls for how scripts from another scope can alter tables in a scoped application. It is not primarily used to track the user who developed an application.

questions.prompt: Which one of the following is true regarding Application Scope?
choices: All applications are automatically part of the Global scope
Applications downloaded from 3rd party ServiceNow application developers cannot have naming conflicts
Any developer can edit any application
Developers can choose the prefix for a scope’s namespace
correct_answers: Applications downloaded from 3rd party ServiceNow application developers cannot have naming conflicts
questions.explanation: Applications downloaded from 3rd party ServiceNow application developers cannot have naming conflicts as each application is assigned a unique scope.

questions.prompt: Identify the incorrect statement about Delegated Development in ServiceNow.
choices: Administrators can grant non-admin users the ability to develop global applications
Administrators can specify which application file types the developer can access
Administrators can grant the developer access to script fields
Administrators can grant the developer access to security records
correct_answers: Administrators can grant non-admin users the ability to develop global applications
questions.explanation: Administrators cannot grant non-admin users the ability to develop global applications. Delegated Development is limited to scoped applications within specific application scopes.

questions.prompt: One of the uses of the ServiceNow REST API Explorer is:
choices: Practice using REST to interact with public data providers
Find resources on the web for learning about REST
Convert SOAP Message functions to REST methods
Create sample code for sending REST requests to ServiceNow
correct_answers: Create sample code for sending REST requests to ServiceNow
questions.explanation: One of the uses of the ServiceNow REST API Explorer is to create sample code for sending REST requests to ServiceNow.

questions.prompt: In a Business Rule, which one of the following returns true if the currently logged in user has the admin role?
questions.explanation: gs.hasRole('admin') returns true if the currently logged in user has the admin role.

questions.prompt: From the list below, identify one reason an application might NOT be a good fit with ServiceNow. The application:
choices: Requires 'as-is' use of low-level programming libraries
Uses forms extensively to interact with data
correct_answers: Requires 'as-is' use of low-level programming libraries
questions.explanation: An application might not be a good fit with ServiceNow if it requires the 'as-is' use of low-level programming libraries.

questions.prompt: When configuring a REST Message, the Endpoint is:
choices: The commands to the REST script to stop execution
The URI of the data to be accessed, queried, or modified
Information about the format of the returned data
The response from the provider indicating there is no data to send back
correct_answers: The URI of the data to be accessed, queried, or modified
questions.explanation: When configuring a REST Message, the Endpoint refers to the URI of the data to be accessed, queried, or modified.

questions.prompt: When evaluating Access Controls, ServiceNow searches and evaluates:
choices: Only for matches on the current table
Only for matches on the current field
From the most specific match to the most generic match
From the most generic match to the most specific match
correct_answers: From the most specific match to the most generic match
questions.explanation: When evaluating Access Controls, ServiceNow searches and evaluates from the most specific match to the most generic match.

questions.prompt: When configuring a module, what does the Override application menu roles configuration option do?
choices: Users with the module role but without access to the application menu access the module
Self-Service users can access the module even though they do not have roles
Admin is given access to the module even if Access Controls would ordinarily prevent access
Users with access to the application menu can see the module even if they don’t have the module role
correct_answers: Users with the module role but without access to the application menu access the module
questions.explanation: The 'Override application menu roles' configuration option allows users with the module role but without access to the application menu to access the module.

questions.prompt: Which platform feature can be used to determine the relationships between fields in an Import Set table to fields in an existing ServiceNow table?
questions.explanation: A Transform Map can be used to determine the relationships between fields in an Import Set table and fields in an existing ServiceNow table.

questions.prompt: A graphical view of relationships among tables is a <blank>.
questions.explanation: A schema map provides a graphical view of relationships among tables in ServiceNow.

questions.prompt: Which one of the following is NOT true for Modules?
choices: Every Module must be part of an Application Menu
Access to Modules is controlled with roles
Every Module must be associated with a table
correct_answers: Every Module must be associated with a table
questions.explanation: Modules in ServiceNow open content pages and their access is controlled with roles. However, not every module needs to be associated with a table.

questions.prompt: What are Application Files in a ServiceNow application?
choices: An XML export of an application's table records
CSV files containing data imported into an application
XML exports of an application's Update Set
questions.explanation: Application Files in ServiceNow refer to the artifacts comprising an application, including scripts, UI elements, data sources, and more.

questions.prompt: What is the purpose of the Application Picker?
choices: Choose an application to edit and set the Application Scope
Select an application as a favorite in the Application Navigator
Choose an application to download and install
questions.explanation: The Application Picker in ServiceNow is used to select an application to view its content and functionality.

questions.prompt: Can inherited fields be deleted from a table?
choices: Yes, select the red X in the left-most column in the table definition
Yes, but only if there has never been any saved field data
Yes, but only if they are text fields
No, inherited fields cannot be deleted from a child table
correct_answers: No, inherited fields cannot be deleted from a child table
questions.explanation: Inherited fields cannot be deleted from a child table in ServiceNow. They are part of the table's structure and inheritance hierarchy.

questions.prompt: What scripts, reports, and other application artifacts will be in a published application?
choices: Enter the name of the Application in the Global search field
Examine the Application Files Related List in the application to be published
Open the list of Update Sets for the instance
Open the artifact records individually to verify the value in the Application field
correct_answers: Examine the Application Files Related List in the application to be published
questions.explanation: To determine the scripts, reports, and other application artifacts in a published application, you can examine the Application Files Related List in the application record.

questions.prompt: Which one of the following is NOT a UI Action type?
questions.explanation: Form choice is not a valid UI Action type in ServiceNow. The available UI Action types include list choice, list banner button, and form button.

questions.prompt: Which one of the following is true for a Script Include with a Protection Policy value of Protected?
choices: Any user with the protected_edit role can see and edit the Script Include
The Protection policy option can only be enabled by a user with the admin role
The Protection Policy is applied only if the glide.app.apply_protection system property value is true
The Protection Policy is applied only if the application is downloaded from the ServiceNow App Store
correct_answers: The Protection Policy is applied only if the application is downloaded from the ServiceNow App Store
questions.explanation: A Script Include with a Protection Policy value of Protected applies the protection policy only if the application is downloaded from the ServiceNow App Store.

questions.prompt: When evaluating Access Controls, ServiceNow searches and evaluates:
choices: Only for matches on the current table
From the most specific match to the most generic match
Only for matches on the current field
From the most generic match to the most specific match
correct_answers: From the most specific match to the most generic match
questions.explanation: When evaluating Access Controls, ServiceNow searches and evaluates from the most specific match to the most generic match.

questions.prompt: When configuring a REST Message, the Endpoint is:
choices: The commands to the REST script to stop execution
Information about the format of the returned data
The URI of the data to be accessed, queried, or modified
The response from the provider indicating there is no data to send back
correct_answers: The URI of the data to be accessed, queried, or modified
questions.explanation: When configuring a REST Message, the Endpoint refers to the URI of the data to be accessed, queried, or modified.

questions.prompt: Application developers configure ServiceNow using industry standard JavaScript to…
choices: Enable the right-click to edit the context menus on applications in the navigator
Customize the organization’s company logo and banner text
Configure the outgoing email display name
questions.explanation: Application developers configure ServiceNow using industry standard JavaScript to extend and add functionality to the platform.

questions.prompt: How must Application Access be configured to prevent all other private application scopes from creating configuration records on an application’s data tables?
choices: You must create Access Controls to prevent all other application scopes from creating configuration records on an application’s data tables rather than using Application Access
Set the Accessible from field value to This application scope only and de-select the Allow access to this table via web services option
Set the Accessible from field value to All application scopes and de-select the Can create option
Set the Accessible from field value to This application scope only
correct_answers: Set the Accessible from field value to This application scope only
questions.explanation: To prevent other private application scopes from creating configuration records on an application's data tables, you need to configure Application Access by setting the Accessible from field value to 'This application scope only'.

questions.prompt: What module in the Service Catalog application does an Administrator access to begin creating a new catalog item?
questions.explanation: To create a new catalog item in the Service Catalog application, an Administrator would access the 'Maintain Items' module.

questions.prompt: How is the Event Log different from the Event Registry?
choices: Event Log contains generated Events, the Event Registry is a table of Event definitions
Event Log is formatted in the Log style, the Event Registry displays different fields
Event Log lists Events that were triggered by integrations, the Event Registry lists the Events that were triggered during the day (24-hour period)
Event Log is the same as the Event Registry
correct_answers: Event Log contains generated Events, the Event Registry is a table of Event definitions
questions.explanation: The Event Log in ServiceNow contains generated events, while the Event Registry is a table of event definitions.

questions.prompt: Which of the following steps can be used to import new data into ServiceNow from a spreadsheet?
choices: Load Data, Create Transform Map, Run Transform
Define Data Source, Select Transform Map, Run Transform
Select Import Set, Select Transform Map, Run Transform
correct_answers: Load Data, Create Transform Map, Run Transform
questions.explanation: To import new data into ServiceNow from a spreadsheet, you can use the steps: Load Data, Create Transform Map, and Run Transform.

questions.prompt: Tables are made up of which of the following?
questions.explanation: Tables in ServiceNow are made up of records (rows) and fields (columns). Lists and forms are UI elements used to interact with table data.

questions.prompt: What are the three components of a filter condition?
questions.explanation: A filter condition in ServiceNow consists of three components: Field, Operator, and Value. These components define the criteria for filtering records.

questions.prompt: Access Control rules may be defined with which of the following permission requirements? (Choose three.)
questions.explanation: Access Control rules in ServiceNow can be defined with roles, conditional expressions, and scripts. These permission requirements control access to data and functionality.

questions.prompt: Which term best describes something that is created, has work performed upon it, and is eventually moved to a state of closed?
questions.explanation: In ServiceNow, a task represents something that is created, has work performed upon it, and is eventually moved to a state of closed.

questions.prompt: Which one of the following is true for a Script Include with a Protection Policy value of Protected?
choices: Any user with the protected_edit role can see and edit the Script Include
The Protection policy option can only be enabled by a user with the admin role
The Protection Policy is applied only if the glide.app.apply_protection system property value is true
The Protection Policy is applied only if the application is downloaded from the ServiceNow App Store
correct_answers: The Protection Policy is applied only if the application is downloaded from the ServiceNow App Store
questions.explanation: A Script Include with a Protection Policy value of Protected applies the protection policy only if the application is downloaded from the ServiceNow App Store.

questions.prompt: Which one of the following is true for GlideUser (g_user) methods?
choices: Can be used in Client Scripts and UI Policies only
Can be used in Business Rules only
Can be used in Client Scripts, UI Policies, and UI Actions
Can be used in Business Rules and Scripts Includes
correct_answers: Can be used in Client Scripts, UI Policies, and UI Actions
questions.explanation: GlideUser (g_user) methods can be used in Client Scripts, UI Policies, and UI Actions in ServiceNow.

questions.prompt: Which roles grant access to source control repository operations such as importing applications from source control, or linking an application to source control? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: The roles 'source_control' and 'admin' grant access to source control repository operations in ServiceNow.

questions.prompt: When configuring the content of an Email Notification, which syntax should be used to reference the properties of an event triggering the Notification?
questions.explanation: To reference the properties of an event triggering an Email Notification, the syntax '${event.<property name>}' should be used.

questions.prompt: Which method call returns true only if the currently logged in user has the catalog_admin role and in no other case?
questions.explanation: The method call 'g_user.hasRoleExactly('catalog_admin')' returns true only if the currently logged in user has the 'catalog_admin' role and no other roles.

questions.prompt: There is a basic strategy when creating a Utils Script Include. Identify the step that does not belong.
choices: Create a prototype object from the new class
questions.explanation: When creating a Utils Script Include, identifying the table is not a step in the basic strategy. The steps include scripting the function(s), creating a class, and creating a prototype object from the new class.

questions.prompt: When working in the Form Designer, configuring the label of a field in a child table changes the label on which table(s)?
questions.explanation: When configuring the label of a field in a child table using the Form Designer, it changes the label only on the child table, not on other tables.

questions.prompt: Which one of the following is true?
choices: A UI Policy's Actions execute before the UI Policy's Scripts
The execution order for a UI Policy's Scripts and Actions is determined at runtime
A UI Policy's Scripts execute after the Client Script
A UI Policy's Actions and Scripts execute at the same time
correct_answers: A UI Policy's Scripts execute after the Client Script
questions.explanation: In ServiceNow, a UI Policy's Scripts execute after the Client Script is executed.

questions.prompt: Modules must have a Link type. Which one of the following is a list of Link types?
choices: List of Records, Separator, Catalog Type, Roles
Assessment, List of Records, Separator, Timeline Page
List of Records, Content Page, Order, URL (from arguments:)
Assessment, List of Records, Content Page, Roles
correct_answers: Assessment, List of Records, Separator, Timeline Page
questions.explanation: In ServiceNow, the list of Link types for Modules includes Assessment, List of Records, Separator, and Timeline Page.

questions.prompt: Which one of the following is true for a table with the 'Allow configuration' Application Access option selected?
choices: Only the in-scope application's scripts can create Business Rules for the table
Any user with the application's user role can modify the application's scripts
Out of scope applications can create Business Rules for the table
Out of scope applications can add new tables to the scoped application
correct_answers: Out of scope applications can create Business Rules for the table
questions.explanation: When the 'Allow configuration' Application Access option is selected for a table, out of scope applications can create Business Rules for that table.

questions.prompt: Which of the following is NOT supported by Flow Designer?
choices: Call a subflow from a flow
Run a flow from a MetricBase Trigger
questions.explanation: Flow Designer in ServiceNow does not support testing a flow with rollback.

questions.prompt: Which of the following are true for reports in ServiceNow? (Choose two.)
choices: Any user can see any report shared with them.
Can be a graphical representation of data.
All users can generate reports on any table.
Can be run on demand by authorized users.
correct_answers: Can be a graphical representation of data.
Can be run on demand by authorized users.
questions.explanation: Reports in ServiceNow can be a graphical representation of data and can be run on demand by authorized users. Report visibility can be controlled by sharing settings.

questions.prompt: Which of the following features are available to Global applications? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: The features 'Automated Test Framework' and 'Flow Designer' are available to Global applications in ServiceNow. Delegated Development is not supported in the Global scope.

questions.prompt: Which Application Access configuration field(s) are NOT available if the Can read configuration field is NOT selected?
choices: All access to this table via web services
Can create, Can update, and Can delete
Can read does not affect the availability of other Application Access fields
correct_answers: Can create, Can update, and Can delete
questions.explanation: If the 'Can read' configuration field is not selected in Application Access, the fields 'Can create,' 'Can update,' and 'Can delete' are not available.

questions.prompt: What is the best UX format to use for lists and forms?
questions.explanation: The best UX format to use for lists and forms in ServiceNow is 'Classic.'

questions.prompt: Which script types execute on the server? (Choose three.)
questions.explanation: The script types 'Business Rule,' 'Scheduled Jobs,' and 'Script Actions' execute on the server side in ServiceNow.

questions.prompt: Identify characteristic(s) of a Record Producer. (Choose three.)
choices: All records created using this strategy are inserted into the Requested Item [sc_req_item] table.
Graphics can be included on the user interface.
Each field prompts the user with a question rather than a field label.
You can script behaviors of fields in the user interface.
correct_answers: Graphics can be included on the user interface.
Each field prompts the user with a question rather than a field label.
You can script behaviors of fields in the user interface.
questions.explanation: Characteristics of a Record Producer in ServiceNow include the ability to include graphics on the user interface, prompt users with questions for each field, and script behaviors of fields in the user interface. All records created using this strategy are inserted into the Requested Item [sc_req_item] table.

questions.prompt: Application developers can specify which ServiceNow page a user sees after submitting a new record using the Record Producer UI. How is the page specified?
choices: Create an application property to store the URL
Write an after Business Rule script for the Record Producer's table: window.redirect = '<URL>';
Configure the page in the Module that opens the Record Producer UI
Write a script in the Record Producer's Script field: producer.redirect = '<URL>';
correct_answers: Write a script in the Record Producer's Script field: producer.redirect = '<URL>';

questions.prompt: Which roles grant access to source control repository operations such as importing applications from source control, or linking an application to source control? (Choose two.)

questions.prompt: Which method call returns true only if the currently logged in user has the catalog_admin role and in no other case?

questions.prompt: There is a basic strategy when creating a Utils Script Include. Identify the step that does not belong.

questions.prompt: When working in the Form Designer, configuring the label of a field in a child table changes the label on which table(s)?

Out of scope applications can add new tables to the scoped application

questions.prompt: What ServiceNow feature can be triggered by events and is used to inform users about activities or updates in ServiceNow?
questions.explanation: Notifications in ServiceNow can be triggered by events and are used to inform users about activities or updates in the platform.

questions.prompt: ServiceNow is good for media streaming. True or false?
questions.explanation: ServiceNow is not designed for media streaming purposes.

questions.prompt: g_user.hasRole('x_foo_app_user') - this returns true for the admin role. True or false?
questions.explanation: The 'g_user.hasRole' method returns true for the admin role, as the admin role includes other roles.

questions.prompt: What Business Rule type executes its logic before a database operation occurs?
questions.explanation: A 'Before' Business Rule type executes its logic before a database operation occurs in ServiceNow.

questions.prompt: What Business Rule type executes its logic immediately after a database operation occurs and before the resulting form is rendered for the user?
questions.explanation: An 'After' Business Rule type executes its logic immediately after a database operation occurs and before the resulting form is rendered for the user in ServiceNow.

questions.prompt: What Business Rule type executes asynchronously?
questions.explanation: An 'Async' Business Rule type executes asynchronously in ServiceNow.

questions.prompt: What allows direct scripting access to fields and field values on related records?
questions.explanation: Dot-Walking allows direct scripting access to fields and field values on related records in ServiceNow.

questions.prompt: An ACL can't have a 'NONE' Access Control and a '*' Access Control. True or false?
questions.explanation: An ACL in ServiceNow can have both 'NONE' and '*' Access Control configurations.

questions.prompt: An application system property can be a reference field. True or false?
questions.explanation: An application system property in ServiceNow cannot be a reference field.

questions.prompt: ServiceNow can only respond to events which are registered with the ____________.
questions.explanation: ServiceNow can only respond to events that are registered with the Event Registry.

questions.prompt: Default homepages can be customized.
questions.explanation: Default homepages in ServiceNow can be customized.

questions.prompt: __________ option makes a field a record's unique key
questions.explanation: The 'Coalesce' option makes a field a record's unique key in ServiceNow.

questions.prompt: Assume an application scope, sn_my_app, exists. Scripts from other application scopes can never delete records from tables in the sn_my_app scope. True or false?
questions.explanation: Scripts from other application scopes can delete records from tables in the sn_my_app scope if the appropriate accessibility configuration is set.

questions.prompt: An application owns its tables and determine whether other applications can access resources from them. True or false?
questions.explanation: An application in ServiceNow owns its tables and determines whether other applications can access resources from them.

questions.prompt: Developers DO or DO NOT create application file records directly from the Application File table
questions.explanation: Developers do not create application file records directly from the Application File table in ServiceNow.

questions.prompt: Removing a field from a form using the Form Designer deletes the field from the database table. True or false?
questions.explanation: Removing a field from a form using the Form Designer does not delete the field from the database table. It only removes it from the form view.

questions.prompt: Team Development uses Git to manage versions. True or false?
questions.explanation: Team Development in ServiceNow uses Git to manage versions.

questions.prompt: Update sets track customizations where the table has an 'update_synch' dictionary attribute. True or false?
questions.explanation: Update sets in ServiceNow track customizations where the table has an 'update_synch' dictionary attribute.

questions.prompt: More than one update set can be the default set for any application scope. True or false?
questions.explanation: In ServiceNow, there can only be one default update set for any application scope.

questions.prompt: ServiceNow is good for real-time data delivery and updates from external sources. True or false?
questions.explanation: ServiceNow is not typically used for real-time data delivery and updates from external sources.

questions.prompt: An unpublished workflow will be captured in an update set. True or false?
questions.explanation: An unpublished workflow will not be captured in an update set in ServiceNow.

questions.prompt: You can define visibility of variables on a task form using the workflow. True or false?
questions.explanation: Visibility of variables on a task form can be defined using the workflow in ServiceNow.

questions.prompt: Sending an email notification is possible via an inbound action. True or false?
questions.explanation: Sending an email notification is possible via an inbound action in ServiceNow.

questions.prompt: Setting up an application in Guided Application Creator guides you through what three steps? (Select three)
questions.explanation: Setting up an application in Guided Application Creator involves defining user roles, choosing user experience, and configuring table configurations.

questions.prompt: The ServiceNow Studio application offers a simple way to do what three things from a tabbed environment? (Select three)
questions.explanation: The ServiceNow Studio application allows you to create, review, and update application files from a tabbed environment.

questions.prompt: In the Next Experience, what provides context for where you are in your instance, and enables you to favorite the item you're viewing?
questions.explanation: In the Next Experience, the contextual app pill provides context for where you are in your instance and allows you to favorite the item you're viewing.

questions.prompt: With the Next Experience landing page, you can access workspaces, classic lists and forms, applications, history, and favorites through the:
questions.explanation: With the Next Experience landing page, you can access workspaces, classic lists and forms, applications, history, and favorites through the Single pane Next Experience UI.

questions.prompt: In the Next Experience, to retrieve any item in the menu, use:
questions.explanation: In the Next Experience, you can retrieve any item in the menu using the 'All menu' option.

questions.prompt: ServiceNow Studio includes which three capabilities? (Select three)
choices: Create an application and application artifacts
correct_answers: Create an application and application artifacts
questions.explanation: ServiceNow Studio includes the capabilities to integrate with source control, create application and application artifacts, and perform code search.

questions.prompt: Which one of the following is NOT a UI Action type?
questions.explanation: The 'Form choice' is not a valid UI Action type in ServiceNow.

questions.prompt: ServiceNow Desktop applications automatically run on which platform(s):
questions.explanation: ServiceNow Desktop applications automatically run on the Desktop and Tablet platforms.

questions.prompt: You are writing an Async Business Rule for a table in a different scope than the Business Rule record. Which one of the following database operations CANNOT be part of the Async Business Rule's configuration?
questions.explanation: In an Async Business Rule configuration, the 'Query' database operation cannot be used.

questions.prompt: Which one of the following is NOT a GlideUser (g_user) method?
questions.explanation: The 'userName()' is not a valid GlideUser method in ServiceNow.

questions.prompt: How do you configure a Scheduled Job to execute on the last day of every month?
choices: Set the Run field value to Periodically and the Repeat Interval value to 31
Set the Run field value to Periodically and the Repeat Interval value to Last Day
Set the Run field value to Monthly and the Day field value to 31
Set the Run field value to Monthly and the Day field value to Last Day
correct_answers: Set the Run field value to Monthly and the Day field value to 31
questions.explanation: To configure a Scheduled Job to execute on the last day of every month, set the Run field value to 'Monthly' and the Day field value to '31'.

questions.prompt: Which utility is used to determine if field names in an Import Set match the field names on the target table when importing data into ServiceNow?
questions.explanation: The 'Auto Map Matching Fields' utility is used to determine if field names in an Import Set match the field names on the target table when importing data into ServiceNow.

questions.prompt: When managing global application files, you can NOT:
choices: Add files from global scope to a global application
Remove files from a global application
Move an application file between global applications
Move application files into or out of a scoped application
correct_answers: Move application files into or out of a scoped application
questions.explanation: When managing global application files in ServiceNow, you cannot move application files into or out of a scoped application.

questions.prompt: Assume an application scope, sn_my_app, exists. Scripts from other application scopes can never delete records from tables in the sn_my_app scope. True or False?
questions.explanation: Scripts from other application scopes can delete records from tables in the sn_my_app scope if the appropriate access is granted.

questions.prompt: Removing a field from a form using the Form Designer deletes the field from the database table. True or False?
questions.explanation: Removing a field from a form using the Form Designer does not delete the field from the database table. It only removes it from the specific form view.

questions.prompt: The Application Access settings for a table are: A. Global application scope, B. All application scopes, C. This application scope, D. ServiceNow application scope
questions.explanation: The Application Access settings 'All application scopes' and 'This application scope' are available for a table, but 'Global application scope' and 'ServiceNow application scope' are not valid options.

questions.prompt: Which of the following is not a Report Type in ServiceNow?
questions.explanation: 'Chart' is not a valid Report Type in ServiceNow.

questions.prompt: Identify the incorrect statement about the Team Development application in ServiceNow.
choices: Team Development allows for branching operations including pushing and pulling record versions between instances
Team Development cannot use Git to manage versions
Developers can compare a development instance to another development instance.
The Dashboard is a central location for all team development activities.
correct_answers: Team Development cannot use Git to manage versions
questions.explanation: Team Development in ServiceNow allows for branching operations, including using Git to manage versions.

questions.prompt: Which of these is used to control access to features and capabilities in applications and modules?
questions.explanation: Roles are used to control access to features and capabilities in applications and modules in ServiceNow.

questions.prompt: Which of the following are NOT methods from the GlideRecord API?
questions.explanation: 'addOrQuery()' and 'addAndQuery()' are not valid methods in the GlideRecord API.

questions.prompt: Which one the following best describes an Angular Providers?
questions.explanation: An Angular Provider is best described as a directive.

questions.prompt: When do onSubmit Client Scripts execute their script logic? (Select three)
choices: When a user clicks the Submit button
When a user clicks the Delete button
When a user clicks the Update button
When a user clicks the Save menu item in the Additional Actions menu.
When a user clicks the Lookup button on a reference field.
correct_answers: When a user clicks the Submit button
When a user clicks the Update button
When a user clicks the Lookup button on a reference field.
questions.explanation: onSubmit Client Scripts execute their script logic when a user clicks the Submit button, when a user clicks the Update button, and when a user clicks the Lookup button on a reference field.

questions.prompt: What one of the following is the correct syntax for adding dynamic content to a notification's HTML message field?
questions.explanation: To add dynamic content to a notification's HTML message field, you use the syntax ${short_description}.

questions.prompt: Which of the following are settings configured in the Application Settings? More than one response may be correct.
questions.explanation: The settings 'Runtime Access Tracking' and 'Restrict Table Choices' can be configured in the Application Settings.

questions.prompt: Which of the following describe what is configured in the Content Negotiation section?
choices: The records available to the API.
The contract between the web service provider and consumer.
questions.explanation: In the Content Negotiation section, you configure the supported request formats and the supported response formats.

questions.prompt: What is the purpose of Embedded Help?
choices: Coach users on using a custom application
Provide specific written or video-based instructions for a custom application
Provide help in languages other than English
Display content based on user role
Display content based on query parameter values
questions.explanation: Embedded Help in ServiceNow serves multiple purposes, including coaching users on using a custom application, providing specific instructions, help in different languages, and content based on user role or query parameter values.

questions.prompt: What value does a Business Rule Condition field return if the field is empty?
questions.explanation: If a Business Rule Condition field is empty, it returns the value 'True'.

questions.prompt: When managing global application files, you can NOT:
choices: Add files from global scope to a global application
Remove files from a global application
Move an application file between global applications
Move application files into or out of a scoped application
correct_answers: Move application files into or out of a scoped application
questions.explanation: When managing global application files, you cannot move application files into or out of a scoped application.

questions.prompt: Which utility is used to determine if field names in an Import Set match the field names on the target table when importing data into ServiceNow?
questions.explanation: The 'Auto Map Matching Fields' utility is used to determine if field names in an Import Set match the field names on the target table when importing data into ServiceNow.

questions.prompt: Which one of the following best describes an inbound email action?
choices: Defines which actions ServiceNow takes in response to incoming email
Cannot manage emails from unknown users
Requires a human to determine which record matches the incoming email
Can only handle replies to notifications sent from ServiceNow
Can only work if a matching outbound message is found
correct_answers: Defines which actions ServiceNow takes in response to incoming email
questions.explanation: An inbound email action in ServiceNow defines which actions the platform takes in response to incoming email.

questions.prompt: What field does the data pill reference? Input Variables->User Group->Group->Manager->Name
choices: The Name of the user from the conversation's manager.
The Name of the manager of a group.
The Name of the manager of a group the user is part of.
The Name of a group the user is part of.
The Name of user from the conversation.
correct_answers: The Name of the manager of a group.
questions.explanation: The data pill 'Input Variables->User Group->Group->Manager->Name' references the Name of the manager of a group.

questions.prompt: Which of the following are true about scheduling in ATF?
choices: Scheduling allows tests to be scheduled to run at a specific date and time.
Schedules can be configured to test specific browsers and browser versions.
Schedules can be configured to test specific operating systems and operating system versions
Schedules run at a configured frequency.
Schedules send results to a watch list of users after completion.
correct_answers: Scheduling allows tests to be scheduled to run at a specific date and time.
Schedules run at a configured frequency.
questions.explanation: In ATF, scheduling allows tests to be scheduled to run at a specific date and time, and schedules run at a configured frequency. Browser and operating system configurations are specified in test configurations, not in the scheduling itself. Results can be sent to a watch list of users after completion.

questions.prompt: A single Client Script can execute its script logic when a user loads a record into a form AND when a user saves/submits/updates a form
questions.explanation: A single Client Script can either execute its script logic when a user loads a record into a form (onLoad) or when a user saves/submits/updates a form (onSubmit), but not both.

questions.prompt: Which of the following are NOT true about the current object?
choices: The current object is automatically instantiated.
The current object property values never change after a record is loaded from the database.
The current and previous objects are always identical.
The current and previous objects are sometimes identical.
The properties of the current object are the same for all Business Rules.
correct_answers: The current object property values never change after a record is loaded from the database.
The current and previous objects are always identical.
The properties of the current object are the same for all Business Rules.
questions.explanation: The current object is automatically instantiated, and its property values can change after a record is loaded from the database. The current and previous objects are sometimes identical, such as immediately after a record is loaded. The properties of the current object are specific to each Business Rule.

questions.prompt: Which Runtime Access Tracking option prevents a script from accessing resources until explicitly allowed?
questions.explanation: The Runtime Access Tracking option 'Enforcing' prevents a script from accessing resources until explicitly allowed.

questions.prompt: How can one user temporarily become another user for testing purposes?
choices: Open the User menu and select the Impersonate User menu item. Select a user to impersonate.
Open User Administration > Users, select a user, and click the Impersonate User related link.
Open the User menu and select the Elevate Roles menu item. Select a user to impersonate.
Open User Administration > Impersonate User and select a user to impersonate.
Select a user to impersonate with the User Picker in the banner.
correct_answers: Open the User menu and select the Impersonate User menu item. Select a user to impersonate.
questions.explanation: To temporarily become another user for testing purposes, open the User menu and select the Impersonate User menu item. Then, select the user you want to impersonate.

questions.prompt: Which one of the following is true for a table with the 'Allow configuration' Application Access option selected?
choices: Only the in scope application’s scripts can create Business Rules for the table
Any user with the application’s user role can modify the application’s scripts
Out of scope applications can create Business Rules for the table when Can Read is also selected
Out of scope applications can add new tables to the scoped application
correct_answers: Out of scope applications can create Business Rules for the table when Can Read is also selected
questions.explanation: For a table with the 'Allow configuration' Application Access option selected, out of scope applications can create Business Rules for the table when the 'Can Read' option is also selected.

questions.prompt: Which items can be configured with multiple roles to grant access?
questions.explanation: Application Menus and Modules can be configured with multiple roles to grant access.

questions.prompt: Which of the following methods creates the response body in the resource script?
questions.explanation: The 'setBody()' method is used to create the response body in the resource script.

questions.prompt: How do you use data from one step in a test in a later step?
choices: Write a script to open the test step object to get the data to use in the later step.
Click the step in the Data Panel and select the data to use in the later step.
Create variables on the test and write scripts to populate the variables when the test executes.
Click the Reference button and select the record from the table.
Click the Data Pill Picker button and select the variable from the data pill picker.
correct_answers: Click the Data Pill Picker button and select the variable from the data pill picker.
questions.explanation: To use data from one step in a test in a later step, you can click the Data Pill Picker button and select the variable from the data pill picker.

questions.prompt: Which of the following modules enables security rule debugging?
choices: System Diagnostics > Debugging > Debug Security Rules
System Diagnostics > Session Debug > Debug Security Rules
System Security > Session Debug > Debug Security Rules
System Security > Debugging > Debug Security Rules
Access Control > Debugging > Debug Security Rule
correct_answers: System Security > Debugging > Debug Security Rules
questions.explanation: The 'System Security > Debugging > Debug Security Rules' module enables security rule debugging.

questions.prompt: Which of the following are possible outcomes when coalescing detects a match between a record in the staging table and a record in the target table?
choices: Halt the import and ask the user what to do
Keep the record already in the target table
Overwrite the record in the target table with the source data
Stop the import and delete the previously imported records
correct_answers: Keep the record already in the target table
Overwrite the record in the target table with the source data
questions.explanation: When coalescing detects a match between a record in the staging table and a record in the target table, the options are to keep the record already in the target table or overwrite the record in the target table with the source data.

questions.prompt: The system can not detect choice and reference type fields when importing data from a spreadsheet
questions.explanation: The system cannot detect choice and reference type fields when importing data from a spreadsheet.

questions.prompt: Which features of Analytics Hub send notifications?
questions.explanation: The features of Analytics Hub that send notifications are thresholds and targets.

questions.prompt: Which of the following are true statements about the ServiceNow Agent mobile application?
choices: There is no charge to install the ServiceNow Agent mobile application on mobile devices
When a developer creates a custom application for desktop, a mobile version of the custom application is automatically created
Business Rules for custom app tables do not apply when records are modified using the ServiceNow Agent mobile application
If a Mobile view is defined for a custom app table, the ServiceNow Agent mobile application uses the Mobile view to create a List screen
Developers can create mobile applications for the ServiceNow Agent mobile application without writing any scripts
correct_answers: There is no charge to install the ServiceNow Agent mobile application on mobile devices
If a Mobile view is defined for a custom app table, the ServiceNow Agent mobile application uses the Mobile view to create a List screen
Developers can create mobile applications for the ServiceNow Agent mobile application without writing any scripts
questions.explanation: The ServiceNow Agent mobile application can be installed on mobile devices without any charge. It uses the Mobile view if defined for a custom app table to create a List screen. Developers can create mobile applications for the ServiceNow Agent mobile application without writing any scripts.

questions.prompt: Removing a field from a form using the Form Designer deletes the field from the database table. True or False?
questions.explanation: Removing a field from a form using the Form Designer does not delete the field from the database table.

questions.prompt: REST API Explorer creates code samples for which of the following languages?
questions.explanation: REST API Explorer creates code samples for cURL, Perl, Python, JavaScript, and PowerShell.

questions.prompt: Which the following are true statements about Record Watch?
choices: Notifies tables when records are changed by widgets
The recordWatch() method is part of the spUtil Widget API class
Is automatically part of a widget's logic
Registers a listener in a widget
Notified when table records are inserted, updated, or deleted
correct_answers: The recordWatch() method is part of the spUtil Widget API class
Registers a listener in a widget
Notified when table records are inserted, updated, or deleted
questions.explanation: Record Watch is a method of the spUtil Widget API class, used to register a listener in a widget. It notifies the widget when table records are inserted, updated, or deleted.

questions.prompt: How do you use data from a subflow in a flow?
choices: Write a script to open the subflow object to get the data to use in the flow.
Create a subflow output and assign the subflow output a value from the Assign subflow output action in the subflow. Subflow outputs are data pills in the flow.
Create data pills in the Data Panel to use when the subflow is added to a flow.
Create an action output and use the Assign subflow output flow logic to assign a value to the output. Subflow outputs are data pills in the flow.
Outputs from all actions in the subflow are automatically available as data pills in the flow.
correct_answers: Create an action output and use the Assign subflow output flow logic to assign a value to the output. Subflow outputs are data pills in the flow.
questions.explanation: To use data from a subflow in a flow, you can create an action output and use the Assign subflow output flow logic to assign a value to the output. Subflow outputs are then available as data pills in the flow.

questions.prompt: Marko is a user in the MSP domain in the hierarchy. The MSP domain has the ACME domain configured as a contains domain. Carl needs to work with records in the ACME EMEA domain. Which configuration change should be made to allow Carl to work with ACME EMEA records?

Configure the MSP domain as a contains domain for the ACME EMEA domain.
Configure the ACME EMEA domain as a visibility domain for Carl Lucas's user record.
Configure the ACME EMEA domain as a visibility domain for the ACME EMEA Technicians group.

questions.prompt: Assume an application scope, sn_my_app, exists. Scripts from other application scopes can never delete records from tables in the sn_my_app scope. True or False?

questions.prompt: Which one of the following best describes the Client Script global function this.server.update()?

questions.prompt: Which of the following must a user have to access and use the Document Feed for a record?

questions.prompt: Which of the following describes how to parse the response body from REST API call?
choices: Use the XML Parser step to extract data from the response body.
Use the JSON Parser step to extract data from the response body.
Use the Parse Response option in the REST step to write the results of the response to output variables.
Create a script step that parses the response body and writes the results to output variables.

questions.prompt: Which of the following are possible data sources for importing data into ServiceNow?

questions.prompt: Which one statement correctly describes Access Control rule evaluation?

questions.prompt: How do you use data from a subflow in a flow?
choices: Write a script to open the subflow object to get the data to use in the flow.
Create a subflow output and assign the subflow output a value from the Assign subflow output action in the subflow. Subflow outputs are data pills in the flow.
Create data pills in the Data Panel to use when the subflow is added to a flow.
Create an action output and use the Assign subflow output flow logic to assign a value to the output. Subflow outputs are data pills in the flow.
Outputs from all actions in the subflow are automatically available as data pills in the flow.
correct_answers: Create an action output and use the Assign subflow output flow logic to assign a value to the output. Subflow outputs are data pills in the flow.
questions.explanation: To use data from a subflow in a flow, you can create an action output and use the Assign subflow output flow logic to assign a value to the output. Subflow outputs are then available as data pills in the flow.

questions.prompt: Marko is a user in the MSP domain in the hierarchy. The MSP domain has the ACME domain configured as a contains domain. Carl needs to work with records in the ACME EMEA domain. Which configuration change should be made to allow Carl to work with ACME EMEA records?
choices: Configure the ACME EMEA domain as a contains domain for the MSP domain.
Configure the MSP domain as a contains domain for the ACME EMEA domain.
Configure the ACME EMEA domain as a visibility domain for Carl Lucas's user record.
Configure the ACME EMEA domain as a visibility domain for the ACME EMEA Technicians group.
questions.explanation: No change is necessary. As Marko is a user in the MSP domain, which contains the ACME domain, he already has access to the ACME EMEA domain.

questions.prompt: Assume an application scope, sn_my_app, exists. Scripts from other application scopes can never delete records from tables in the sn_my_app scope. True or False?
questions.explanation: False. Scripts from other application scopes can delete records from tables in the sn_my_app scope if they have the appropriate permissions.

questions.prompt: Which of the following is NOT a type of credential used by REST APIs?
questions.explanation: CIM (Computer-integrated manufacturing) is not a type of credential used by REST APIs.

questions.prompt: Test Management can integrate with PPM?
questions.explanation: True. Test Management can integrate with PPM (Project Portfolio Management).

questions.prompt: gs.getProperty() method is used to retrieve Application Property values in a script?
questions.explanation: True. The 'gs.getProperty()' method is used to retrieve Application Property values in a script.

questions.prompt: Which one of the following best describes the Client Script global function this.server.update()?
choices: Calls the server and posts this.data to the Server Script
Calls the server and automatically replaces the current options and data from the server response
Retrieves the options used to invoke the widget on the server
Calls the Server Script and passes custom input
Retrieves the serialized data object from the Server Script
correct_answers: Calls the server and posts this.data to the Server Script
questions.explanation: The 'this.server.update()' Client Script global function calls the server and posts 'this.data' to the Server Script.

questions.prompt: Which of the following must a user have to access and use the Document Feed for a record?
choices: Access to the record to see the live feed group
Read permissions on the comments field
Write permissions on the comments field if the user wants to add comments
questions.explanation: To access and use the Document Feed for a record, a user must have access to the record to see the live feed group, as well as read or write permissions on the comments field depending on their desired actions.

questions.prompt: Which of the following describes how to parse the response body from REST API call?
choices: Use the XML Parser step to extract data from the response body.
Use the JSON Parser step to extract data from the response body.
Use the Parse Response option in the REST step to write the results of the response to output variables.
Create a script step that parses the response body and writes the results to output variables.
Use the OpenAPI Specification to generate output variables from the response body.
correct_answers: Use the XML Parser step to extract data from the response body.
Create a script step that parses the response body and writes the results to output variables.
questions.explanation: To parse the response body from a REST API call, you can use the XML Parser step to extract data from the response body, or you can create a script step that parses the response body and writes the results to output variables.

questions.prompt: Which of the following are possible data sources for importing data into ServiceNow?
questions.explanation: Possible data sources for importing data into ServiceNow include CSV, JDBC, XML, and HTTP.

questions.prompt: Which one statement correctly describes Access Control rule evaluation?
choices: Rules are evaluated from the general to the specific, so a table rule must be active to continue
Rules are evaluated using roles. The role with the most permissions evaluates the rules first
If more than one rule applies to a row, the older rule is evaluated first
If a row level rule and a field level rule exist, both rules must be true before an operation is allowed
correct_answers: If a row level rule and a field level rule exist, both rules must be true before an operation is allowed
questions.explanation: In Access Control rule evaluation, if a row level rule and a field level rule exist, both rules must be true before an operation is allowed.

questions.prompt: Which of the following should you do before importing data into ServiceNow? More than one response may be correct.
choices: Understand the data you plan to import
Decide what to do with incomplete or erroneous data
Determine which source data maps to which target fields
Delete all the existing target table records to avoid conflicts
correct_answers: Understand the data you plan to import
Decide what to do with incomplete or erroneous data
Determine which source data maps to which target fields
questions.explanation: Before importing data into ServiceNow, it is important to understand the data you plan to import, decide what to do with incomplete or erroneous data, and determine which source data maps to which target fields.

questions.prompt: Which one of the following best describes what a flow is?
choices: The water flowing over Niagara Falls :)
A sequence of steps to automate processes on the Now Platform.
A script that defines the steps to automate processes on the Now Platform
A sequence of actions to automate processes on the Now Platform
A sequence of activities to automate processes on the Now Platform.
correct_answers: A sequence of actions to automate processes on the Now Platform
questions.explanation: A flow is a sequence of actions to automate processes on the Now Platform.

questions.prompt: Which of the following are possible outcomes when coalescing detects a match between a record in the staging table and a record in the target table?
choices: Halt the import and ask the user what to do
Keep the record already in the target table
Overwrite the record in the target table with the source data
Stop the import and delete the previously imported records
correct_answers: Keep the record already in the target table
Overwrite the record in the target table with the source data
questions.explanation: When coalescing detects a match between a record in the staging table and a record in the target table, the options are to keep the record already in the target table or overwrite the record in the target table with the source data.

questions.prompt: The system can not detect choice and reference type fields when importing data from a spreadsheet
questions.explanation: The system cannot detect choice and reference type fields when importing data from a spreadsheet.

questions.prompt: Which features of Analytics Hub send notifications?
questions.explanation: The features of Analytics Hub that send notifications are thresholds and targets.

questions.prompt: Which of the following are true statements about the ServiceNow Agent mobile application?
choices: There is no charge to install the ServiceNow Agent mobile application on mobile devices
When a developer creates a custom application for desktop, a mobile version of the custom application is automatically created
Business Rules for custom app tables do not apply when records are modified using the ServiceNow Agent mobile application
If a Mobile view is defined for a custom app table, the ServiceNow Agent mobile application uses the Mobile view to create a List screen
Developers can create mobile applications for the ServiceNow Agent mobile application without writing any scripts
correct_answers: There is no charge to install the ServiceNow Agent mobile application on mobile devices
If a Mobile view is defined for a custom app table, the ServiceNow Agent mobile application uses the Mobile view to create a List screen
Developers can create mobile applications for the ServiceNow Agent mobile application without writing any scripts
questions.explanation: The ServiceNow Agent mobile application can be installed on mobile devices without any charge. If a Mobile view is defined for a custom app table, the ServiceNow Agent mobile application uses the Mobile view to create a List screen. Developers can create mobile applications for the ServiceNow Agent mobile application without writing any scripts.

questions.prompt: Removing a field from a form using the Form Designer deletes the field from the database table. True or False?
questions.explanation: Removing a field from a form using the Form Designer does not delete the field from the database table.

questions.prompt: REST API Explorer creates code samples for which of the following languages?
questions.explanation: REST API Explorer creates code samples for cURL, Perl, Python, JavaScript, and PowerShell.

questions.prompt: Which the following are true statements about Record Watch?
choices: Notifies tables when records are changed by widgets
The recordWatch() method is part of the spUtil Widget API class
Is automatically part of a widget's logic
Registers a listener in a widget
Notified when table records are inserted, updated, or deleted
correct_answers: The recordWatch() method is part of the spUtil Widget API class
Registers a listener in a widget
Notified when table records are inserted, updated, or deleted
questions.explanation: Record Watch is a method of the spUtil Widget API class, used to register a listener in a widget. It notifies the widget when table records are inserted, updated, or deleted.
